intro: Tordylium divaricatum, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and Central America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive zigzagging stems. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are often clustered in terminal umbels. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly rough texture. Tordylium divaricatum is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and ability to thrive in humid environments.
